intro: Eriophyllum nevadense, commonly known as Sierra goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense clusters of small, bright yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to the arid conditions of its native range. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white hairs. Eriophyllum nevadense plays a role in stabilizing soils and providing nectar for pollinators in its ecosystem.
